snippet: Oreo, who dumped his driver and two passengers near Columbus Circle on Thursday, may end up in a less hectic job or with a new owner.
abstract: Oreo, runaway carriage horse who dumped his driver and two passengers near Columbus Circle in Manhattan, is likely to be retired to a draft-horse sanctuary; horse has become a flash point in reignited debate over the city's carriage horses, with animal rights organizations and anti-carriage groups backing previously proposed City Council legislation that would either ban horse-drawn carriages outright or replace them with electric cars driven by the former carriage drivers.
lead_paragraph: Oreo, who dumped his driver and two passengers near Columbus Circle on Thursday, may end up in a less hectic job or with a new owner.

headline.seo: Carriage Horse That Bolted May End Up on Easy Street
headline.main: Draft Horse That Bolted May End Up on Easy Street
headline.print_headline: Draft Horse That Bolted May End Up On Easy St.
